name: Alexander Tel-Aviv Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Given the number of horrid 5* Hilton style hotels in TV, this place is a good find. Its all suites, the cheap ones are small with no sea view, but clean and up to date. Nice TV and fittings. You get a lot more for your 250 euro in other countries, but for here, this is a pretty good deal.
reviews.title: Nice little place

reviews.text: I spent 1 night at this hotel on a biz trip. I had seen the hotel before but had never had the chance to sleep there. They only have suites and man, they are VERY nice. A docking station for your iPod to help you relax, nice furniture - facilities for cooking if you are into it and an extremely cosy and comfortable bed for the weary traveller (a situation I always find myself in).
reviews.title: Great, super comfortable hotel right next to the Port - rooms are among the nicest I have seen in Tel Aviv

reviews.text: I was leaving early in the morning so the staff prepared a breakfast bag for me to take away - very nice views of the shore and parts of lovely Tel Aviv.
reviews.title: two great weeks in Tel Aviv

reviews.text: I would not hesitate to base myself there for business for a longer stay - it has ALL I needed and much more!
reviews.title: Very good boutique hotel -- bring an alarm clock though

reviews.text: I found the Alexander hotel on tripadvisor and by coincidence friends at the Italian embassy in Tel Aviv spoke highly of it . Also one of the reviews had mentioned the excellent air conditioning , and I must say, for myself that was the determining factor : we booked two suites , a junior for my son and his wife and a de luxe for ourselves , since we particularly wanted to have our grandson with us and give his parents a true vacation.
reviews.title: Very Nice Stay

reviews.text: We stayed here for two nights in a luxurious corner apartment on the sixth floor - wonderful views of the sea and coastline.
reviews.title: Lovely

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This hotel is smart yet understated, quiet and well located. The staff couldn't have been more helpful and the breaktasts were delicious.
reviews.title: Loved the Alexander

likes.liked: — cleanliness, size of suites, comfortable beds
likes.disliked: — location (really i have nothing bad to say about the place...there's really nothing about it that would keep me from recommending it)

reviews.text: I stayed in this hotel with my girlfriend for one night and we were both very impressed with the place.
reviews.title: Great Apart-Hotel

likes.liked: — The rooms, location and dinner menu

reviews.text: You have no need to look further for a nice hotel in Tel Aviv. Stayed at the Alexabder twice during my month's trip to Israel. First stay was with my son in a standard two bedroom suite. Second stay was solo in a luxury one bedroom suite, as that was all that was available. Both suites were most comfortable and quiet. Location of hotel is excellent, on a side street. Walking in one direction is along the Mediterranean promenade with one hotel after the other, walking in the other direction is along the boardwalk of the old port of Tel Aviv with one cafe/restaurant after the other. Mezizim beach two minute walk away - one of Tel Aviv's nicest beaches. Staff was friendly and helpful. Restaurant is located on the 7th floor with a great view of Tel Aviv. Breakfast is excellent; cocktails in the evening very relaxing atmosphere.
reviews.title: Most comfortable, reasonably priced and very well located hotel

reviews.text: As a frequent traveller to Tel Aviv- i've tried them all. Benn to almost all the hotels on the beach promenade, and in the city, and i can't believe it took me so long to find the Alexander. It is simply the BEST hotel in Tel Aviv in every aspect- service, food quality, housekeeping etc. the suites are very big and the rates are very reasonable. Do NOT look anywhere else- stay here and u won't be disappointed. By the way- Sadot hotel is not in Tel Aviv at all, it's about half an hour druve!
reviews.title: UNBELIEVABLE!!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed here for two different trips and therefore in two different rooms. The prices were comparable with all other Tel Aviv hotels but the difference is the quality of the rooms (they are clean, well kept and modern - would suit a family ideally) and the general state of the hotel. The only thing I would have wished for in this hotel is a swimming pool but given that the beach is spitting distance (and the hotel even provides the towels) it is not something which would put me off staying here again. I would also mention that although some rooms are stated to be sea view (and do have large amounts of window space) the hotel is set back from the ocean front by another building so it becomes more of a partial sea view and that parking there is hideously expensive but can be found for cheaper nearby. The restaurant is also notable for its quality and breakfast is substantial and more than satisfactory.
reviews.title: Beats all other Tel Aviv hotels hands down

reviews.text: Best location near beach, huge living room, convenient kitchen. Beautiful roof-top restaurant and bar.
reviews.title: Fantastic location & view & spacious suite

reviews.text: first time in israel and took up tripadvisors top rated hotel_ Sadot. this was not in Tel Aviv. so i left asap and went to see the no.2 cinema hotel. this is not a place for a holiday maker. 20 minutes walk to the beach. nice hotel but dated.
reviews.title: Can't be better

description: The Alexander Tel Aviv Hotel is a luxury boutique hotel that provides a warm, professional and personal hospitality experience with world leading standards, unique trendy suites elegantly designed to offer ultimate pampering luxury. All this to provide our guests with the perfect hospitality experience.Our 70 beautifully designed Suites offer the height of luxury and our attention to detail begins with the design and extends to the warm, friendly, courteous and professional service we strive to deliver.The hotel combines prime location, luxurious design and a contemporary environment.
